title: Longest Palindromic Substring
description: Given a string s, return the longest palindromic substring in s.
constraints: s consist of only digits and English letters

testCases.explanation: Single character is always a palindrome.

solution.explanation:
This solution uses the "expand around center" approach:
1. For each position in the string, we treat it as a potential center of a palindrome
2. We expand outward from the center while characters match
3. We check both odd-length palindromes (single character center) and even-length palindromes (two character center)
4. We keep track of the longest palindrome found so far
5. We return the longest palindrome

Example: s = "babad"
- Center at index 0: expand "b" → "b" (length 1)
- Center at index 1: expand "a" → "aba" (length 3)
- Center at index 2: expand "b" → "bab" (length 3)
- Center at index 3: expand "a" → "a" (length 1)
- Center at index 4: expand "d" → "d" (length 1)
- Result: "bab" or "aba" (both length 3)

Alternative approach using dynamic programming:
- We can use a 2D DP array where dp[i][j] represents if s[i:j+1] is a palindrome
- We fill the DP array and keep track of the longest palindrome

The time complexity is O(n²) as we check each position as a center and expand. The space complexity is O(1) as we only use a constant amount of extra space.
